column4: What's the name of the application that preloads libraries for you? Making loading applications faster?
prelink... take care when using it
is it a mess to use?
no it is not, as long as you dont update or upgrade packages then trouble comes...
because you have to "prelink" everything again
what i did however, was to only prelink OpenOffice...
mmmm, maybe i'll write a script to prelink all the stuff I want prelinked?
yeah, i don't want to prelink everything, like maybe four apps
you can safely, just make sure next time you update that app you prelink it again... i dont know if you know what prelink does...
i only have vague idea about it modifying libaries to make them faster to load
so, updating works fine, the only problem is when those prelinked libraries get updated, they are no longer prelinked?

it kind's of copy symbols or code blocks to the aplications, so an app called foo uses a library called foo.so then prelink looks for the code in foo.so to kind of add it to the app so it loads faster
but updating still works fine right? your updated app is just no longer prelinked?
exactly, so if you update packages then the binaries will be overwritten with the new ones which have been no prelinked
oh, i see what your saying, if an app is dependent upon the library, and the library gets updated, then your app is linked to the old un-updated library?
and sometimes that makes problems, even apps not opening, so you have to do that each time you update stuff
yech, that does sound like it could get messy
how much faster did openoffice startup after you did this?
